alert.note: Alert for Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 30 at 7:56PM EDT until October 01 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Buchanan and Dickenson. In West Virginia, Boone, Kanawha, Lincoln, Logan, McDowell, Mingo, Northwest Fayette, Northwest Raleigh, Southeast Fayette, Southeast Raleigh and Wyoming. * WHEN...From 11 PM EDT this evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
